definitions.definition: The first of the two terms by which a point is referred to, in a system of fixed rectilinear coordinate (Cartesian coordinate) axes.
examples: The point ( 3 , 2 ) {\displaystyle (3,2)} has 3 as its abscissa and 2 as its ordinate.
definitions.dating_raw: First attested in the late 17 century.

definitions.definition: The horizontal line representing an axis of a Cartesian coordinate system, on which the abscissa (sense above) is shown.

main_definition: ( geometry ) The first of the two terms by which a point is referred to, in a system of fixed rectilinear coordinate (Cartesian coordinate) axes. [First attested in the late 17 century.]
secondary_definitions: ( geometry ) The horizontal line representing an axis of a Cartesian coordinate system, on which the abscissa (sense above) is shown.
